page.title: 12MEMORIES OF LIFE IN OGBOURNE
page.content: Life was hard fifty years ago.Few huses had bathrooms or hot water and everyone cooked on a coal range.Not all houses had electricity so living rooms were lit by oil lamps, bedrooms by candles. Most people had more fun with dances, whist-drives and summer concert parties in the village hall.People saved money weekly, so that their children could enjoy the Christmas party and go on the seaside summer outing for the day, their only journey out of the area. Children had few toys (marbles,tops, conkers) but the village boys had a band.They collected old tins and {"marched around the village bashing {them and singing at the tops of our {voices".}They sledged in the snow, warming their hands with tins filled with smouldering rags.
